sections: From side pipes to a continental tire kit, this '57 Chevy is ready to roll!

Few cars are instantly recognizable by their make and model year, but the '57 Chevy is probably the most notable exception. From its bold bumper to its fantastic fins, the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air is an automotive icon, and this fully restored example is ready to join any collection as a high-quality show car and cruiser. If you're looking for a super-clean, turn-key '57 Chevy, Art & Speed has just what you're looking for, and it's priced to sell at $67,900.

This Bel Air underwent an extensive restoration, and the overall quality is obvious by checking out the black paint job, the black-and-red interior and even the spot-free undercarriage. Adding to the vintage Tri-Five looks, this Bel Air is rocking wire wheels with white wall tires, electric cutouts with big, chrome side pipes and a continental tire kit. The Bel Air's extensive chrome and aluminum trim is a perfect complement to the deep, black paint, and the interior looks absolutely flawless.

Under the hood, this Bel Air is powered by a 283 CID V8, which no doubt sounds amazing through the side pipes. This engine is paired to a column-mounted three-speed manual, and to ensure this car is as fun to cruise in as it is to show, it also has power steering, power brakes and air conditioning. For added reliability, this Chevy also has an aluminum radiator and an Optima RedTop battery.

This fully restored 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air probably won't last long at this price, so be sure to contact Art & Speed for more information on this car or any of the other classic and collector cars they have listed for sale.
